chapters.text:
-------------------------------
|          CHAPTER 1          |
-------------------------------


###You are walking home after a long day.
#There's no doubt, this hasn't been a nice day.
#You missed every possible bus and/or train.
#And it started raining,# too. #Of course, you do not have an umbrella with you.

#Looking up at the sky, it looks like all the clouds in the world just decided to gather right above your head,#
swallowing all of light and propagating dark vibes to the atmosphere and to the ground.

A $WLightning$C suddenly strikes, #not too far away!

##You shudder, stunned with its power.

##After few breathless seconds, #you breathe again 
and smell the ozone that was formed by the action of the electricity over the oxygen molecules.

##You realise you have to move fast if you don't want to end up way more soaked than you already are.



(Select with arrow keys and press enter).

choices.desc: You start running. Let's minimise the water intake.
The water does not bother you that much. You are already soaked. So why rush?

chapters.text:
Speeding through the water, you feel the drops of rain smashing onto your face and body with unexpected strenght.
#You run even faster, trying to ignore the suffocating feeling of the water splashing down your face.
#
The wind howls between the unstopping, ever increasing noise of water hammering the asphalt.
#You feel your heart bouncing in your chest and hear your now accelerated breathing.
#
You are almost home, when you hear it.
#
$G...$C
###
Was it real? 
##For a split second you thought someone called on your name. It must have been all that noise...
#
#$G..ris..$C
###
It was clearer this time!

Resigned to your fate, you try to keep your head down,
trying to avoid being temporarily blinded by the water in your eyes.
#
The wind howls between the unstopping, ever increasing noise of water hammering the asphalt.
#
You also try to avoid the huge pools of water that are now forming on the road,
praying that no vehicle will rush over them splattering you with some nice mud.
#
You reach the bottom of the little hill that is in front of your house.
#You raise your eyes, and right when you are about to turn towards your gate, you see something.
#
On the top of the hill, there is something...# someone...# you can't say for sure.
##

choices.desc: You think you saw it wrong. Why waste time climbing the hill with this weather?
You decide to go and check. Someone could need help.

chapters.text:
You turn around, looking for the source of the voice.
#
It's hard to see something in the midst of this unexpected thunderstorm.
#You squint your eyes, fighting against the trickles of water that run into your eyes
#
After few seconds, you think you're seeing something.# On the top of the hill in front of your house.
#It looks like there is something... #someone...# there.
##But then you realise it's quite unlikely you could have heard your name called from that distance,
with all that noise.##

choices.desc: You hate to stay more time under the rain... but... you never know?
You must have misheard. And if something's there, it's none of your business.

chapters.text:
You painstakingly reach the top of the hill, where a lonely big oak tree stands.
#It looks like nobody is here after all.
#
You are about to go back down, to the comfort of your home at last, when you hear it!
#
$GChris!$C
#
You heard it right, you can't be wrong. It feels like the wind is calling your name to the rain...
#You feel a tingling sensation in the back of your neck,# somehow you $Wfeel$C someone's behind you.
#
#Then...## it all happen in an instant...##

The figure at the corner of your eye...
###The realisation that standing beneath a tree during a storm is not the safest option...
###The blinding light and the deafening boom suddenly engulfing you.
###
###Then...## only darkness.##

You are about to enter past your gate, to the comfort of your home at last, when you hear it!
#
$GChris!$C
#
It feels like the wind is calling your name to the rain...
#It feels like the sound comes from behind your shoulders, but at the same time from afar.

#You feel a tingling sensation in the back of your neck,# somehow you $Wfeel$C someone's behind you.
#
#Then...## it all happen in an instant...##

The figure at the corner of your eye...
###The blinding light...
###The deafening boom suddenly engulfing you.
###
###Then...## only darkness.
